title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 4, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 4, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. the numbers 2 and 4 are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, high above the origin, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at approximately 1.2, and ends far below the x axis, just to the left of x equals 2.

The figure presents the graph of a curve the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 2 and 4 are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, far below the origin, and moves upward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at approximately 0.8, and continues upward until it levels off and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 1.8. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 2.2, and continues downward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local minimum far below the x axis, where x equals 3. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 3.7, and ends above the x axis, where x equals 4.

The figure presents the graph of a curve the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. the numbers 2 and 4 are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins at the origin, and moves upward and to the right until it levels off high above the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 0.2. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 0.5, and continues downward until it levels off far below the x axis, where x is approximately 0.8. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 1.2, and continues upward until it levels off high above the x axis, where x is approximately 1.5. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 1.95, and levels off far below the x axis, where x is approximately 2.2. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 2.5, and levels off high above the x axis where x is approximately 2.8. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 3.2, and ends far below the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. the numbers 2 and 4 are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, high above the origin, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at approximately 0.2, and continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum far below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 0.8. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 1.8, and continues upward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 2.2. The curve then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 3, and ends far below the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. the numbers 2 and 4 are indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, high above the origin, and moves downward and to the right. It crosses the x axis at approximately 0.2, and continues downward until it levels off and reaches a local minimum far below the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 0.8. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 1.8, and continues upward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x is approximately equal to 2.2. The curve then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 3, and ends far below the x axis.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
